dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.
dependencies.name: libx11

dependencies.description:
This library contains miscellaneous utilities and is not part of the
Xlib standard. It contains routines which only use public interfaces so
that it may be layered on top of any proprietary implementation of Xlib
or Xt.
dependencies.name: libxmu

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependent_to.description: Cross-platform Text Expander written in Rust
dependent_to.name: espanso

dependent_to.description: A minimal password manager following the UNIX philosphy.
dependent_to.name: pass

dependent_to.description: A cross-platform clipboard module for Python.
dependent_to.name: py-pyperclip

dependent_to.description:
Read and Write from the System Clipboard. Simple utility functions to
read from and write to the Windows, OS X, and X11 clipboards.
dependent_to.name: r-clipr

dependent_to.description:
Functions to Make Surveys Processing Easier. Set of functions to make
the processing and analysis of surveys easier: interactive shiny apps
and addins for data recoding, contingency tables, dataset metadata
handling, and several convenience functions.
dependent_to.name: r-questionr

description:
xclip is a command line utility that is designed to run on any system
with an X11 implementation. It provides an interface to X selections
("the clipboard") from the command line. It can read data from standard
in or a file and place it in an X selection for pasting into other X
applications. xclip can also print an X selection to standard out, which
can then be redirected to a file or another program.
name: xclip

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
